meanings.definition: Feel sad, repentant, or disappointed over (something that has happened or been done, especially a loss or missed opportunity)
meanings.sent1: She was regretting not studying for the test.
meanings.sent2: He is regretting missing the bus this morning.
meanings.sent3: The cat was regretting knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The tree seemed to be regretting losing its leaves in the fall.
meanings.sent5: The child was regretting breaking his favorite toy.

meanings.definition: Express disappointment or sadness over (something that has happened or been done)
meanings.sent1: They regretted not attending the party.
meanings.sent2: She regrets telling her secret to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The dog regretted chewing up the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The clouds seemed to regretting raining on the picnic.
meanings.sent5: He regretted shouting at his friend.

meanings.definition: To feel sorrow or remorse for (an act, fault, disappointment, etc.)
meanings.sent1: He was regretting his harsh words.
meanings.sent2: She is regretting not apologizing sooner.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel regretted stealing the nuts.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to be regretting flooding the town.
meanings.sent5: The student regretted not listening to the teacher.
